Avatar.description:
An Etsy member's avatar image.The ListingImage resource includes
fields for the following sizes, which be officially supported by Etsy at least
through the end of 2013:
Additional sizes are available but do not have specific fields in the
resource. Instead, treat the full size URL as a template. Use the

ImageType methods to retrieve available sizes for listing images;
any of these can be subsituted in place of "fullxfull" in the full size
URL to make a new URL for the listing image of that size.The 570xN and fullxfull image sizes have variable dimensions depending on the original artwork uploaded by the seller:If the provided sizes don't suit your application, you are free to download the larger image sizes, resize and cache them for your own use, as long as you adhere to our API Terms of Use.Image uploads can be performed using a POST request with the Content-Type: multipart/form-dataheader, following RFC1867.  This is identical to using curl -F, except that that request needs to be signed using OAuth.Your OAuth toolkit must support multipart form uploads as described above.  Here is example code for PHP using the PECL OAuth 1.1 extension (PECL OAuth 1.0 will not work):This resource has no associations.

Feedback.description: Etsy allows buyers and sellers to leave feedback for one another about a specific transaction.  Each feedback record contains a short message from the buyer or seller, a value of -1, 0 or 1, and information about the item that was purchased.Each feedback record has a buyer, a seller, an author, and a subject.  Because feedback is a two-way process, each transaction on Etsy can have up to two feedback records, one left by a buyer in reference to a seller, and one left by a seller in reference to a buyer.  To determine the context of a feedback record, you will neeed to examine both the creator_user_id and seller_user_id fields to determine whether the author of the feedback was the buyer or the seller in the transaction.As of March 14, 2011, all purchases on Etsy are hidden from public areas.  This has a direct effect on how feedback records are displayed in the API, since they contain information about a member's purchases.  Certain fields of feedback records are now treated as private--this means that they can only been seen using the private API, with either the buyer or seller's OAuth credentials.  If these conditions are not met, the fields will be missing from feedback responses.The context of the API request (whether you are requesting the buyer's or the seller's feedback) has an impact on which fields are considered private. In a nutshell:The following table gives detailed information on which feeds will be private in various contexts.  "Feedback Author" refers to the member who left the feedback (either the buyer, or the seller). "Viewing Context" refers to the member whose user ID was used to query the feedback (whether we are viewing feedback for the seller, or for the buyer).This table lists which fields fall under the general headings in the table above:

creator_user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user who wrote this feedback.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

target_user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user who received this feedback.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

seller_user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user who was the seller in this transaction.

buyer_user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user who was the buyer in this transaction.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

message.description: A message left by the author, explaining the feedback.

value.description: The feedback's value; 1 is positive, -1 is negative, and 0 is neutral.

image_feedback_id.description: The numeric ID of the feedback's image (if present).  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

image_url_25x25.description: The url to a photo provided with the feedback, dimensions 25x25.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

image_url_155x125.description: The url to a photo provided with the feedback, dimensions 155x125.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

image_url_fullxfull.description: The url to a photo provided with the feedback, dimensions fullxfull.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

Buyer.description: The user who who was the buyer in this transaction.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

Seller.description: The user who was the seller in this transaction.

Author.description: The user who wrote this feedback.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

Subject.description: The user who received this feedback.  Note: This field may be absent, depending on the buyer's privacy settings.

Transaction.description: The transaction that this feedback pertains to.

Listing.description: The listing that this feedback pertains to.

Returns a set of FeedBack objects associated to a User.

findAllFeedbackFromSellers.description:
Returns a set of FeedBack objects associated to a User.
                    This is essentially the union between
                    the findAllUserFeedbackAsBuyer and findAllUserFeedbackAsSubject methods.

Guest.description: A Guest represents an anonymous user that is using the Etsy API that has not yet authenticated, but may wish to store some information before authenticating (currently, guest carts). Guests are identified via a random 13-digit hash, which is unique to every Application. Important: This guest ID is associated directly to your Application, and will not be accessible through other API keys. Although Guests do not require an authenticated user, they do require your app to have production access in order to be interacted with.This resource has no associations.

guest_id.description: The ID that associates to the guest - a random 13-digit hash. Validated by the regular expression '/^[a-zA-Z0-9-_]+$/'. Each ID is identified internally to the Application that created it, meaning that other applications will not have access to this guest, even with the same ID.

checkout_url.description: The URL to send the user's browser to on checkout. This will allow them to use this guest ID to check out with the carts associated. Please note that a guest cart's data are undefined after being merged on checkout.

generateGuest.description: A helper method that generates a Guest ID to associate to this anonymous session. This method is not strictly necessary, as any sufficiently random guest ID that is 13 characters in length will suffice and automatically create a guest account on use if it does not yet exist.

claimGuest.description: Claim this guest to the associated user. Merges the GuestCart's associated with this GuestId into the logged in User's Carts. Returns the number of listings merged in meta['listings_merged'].

mergeGuest.description: Merge this guest to a different guest. Merges the GuestCart's associated with this GuestId into the target guest's cart. Returns the number of listings merged in meta['listings_merged'].

uploadListingFile.description:
Upload a new listing file, or attach an existing file to this listing.  You must either provide the listing_file_id
of an existing listing file, or the name and file data of a new file that you are uploading.  If you are attaching
a file to a listing that is currently not digital, the listing will be converted to a digital listing.  This will
cause the listing to have free shipping and will remove any variations.

deleteListingFile.description:
Removes the listing file from this listing.  If this is the last file on a listing, the listing will no longer
be considered a digital listing.

Listing.description:
Listings on Etsy are items for sale.  Each Listing is associated with a User, and with a Shop (Users own Shops.)  Etsy Listings have a creation date, and are valid for approximately four months.  Listings have a price and a quantity, and when they're sold out, the User must renew them before they can be sold again.The state field of Listings indicates whether a Listing is currently available for display on Etsy.  Most of the time, you will only see Listings in the "active" state, but the following states may rarely appear:By default, the method findAllListingActive returns all active Listings on Etsy, paginated by date. Use the optional parameters (such as keyword, min_price, etc.) to narrow these results. The sort_order and sort_on parameters can be used to change the order of returned results.  Note that these parameters are only available when using sort options. Without sort options, they will be ignored (and Listings will be returned newest-first.)The parameters translate_keywords and language may be used in conjunction with keywords to support non-English searches with findAllListingActive and findAllShopListingsActive. If language is set to a value other than en and translate_keywords is true, findAllListingActive will return results for keywords translated from the given language into English. For example, ?keywords=buch&language=de&translate_keywords=true will translate the term "buch" from German into English and search for listings that match the search term "book." If these listings have a German translation, the listing results will be returned in German.To search within a shop, use findAllShopListingsActive.Listings may be edited with the updateListing method. Note that the Etsy API will attempt to activate a Listing after every edit operation. This may result in charges to the user's Etsy bill. To edit an inactive Listing without activating it, pass the optional parameter state=inactive. Note that edit options that increase the quantity of a Listing will result in charges to the owner. It is the developer's responsibility to warn the user that such charges may occur.To renew a Listing for another four months, pass the optional parameter renew=true. A Listing does not need to be expired to be renewed, however note that each renewal does not take the Listing's previous expiration date into account, so any unused time remaining on the Listing's old expiration date will be lost. Renewals will result in charges to a user's bill.Data of some models in the API can be expressed in multiple languages. For example, a Listing's title and description can be translated into German or French.
To access this data in the API you can use the language parameter. Like this /listings/12345?language=de. For more information about this
look at Working with Translations.Categories are no longer the first three tags of a Listing. Category is a first-class resource, with its own primary key ID.  When calling createListing, you must pass a category_id to specify the category for the Listing.The fields who_made, when_made and is_supply are the so-called Marketplace Attributes that help buyers locate a Listing under the headings Handmade, Vintage and Supplies. When creating new Listings, these parameters are required. As of this writing, not all Listings on Etsy have their Marketplace Attributes set.  These Listings will return null in these fields.With the introduction of Custom Order Requests, sellers may now designate a listing as private, which indicates it is reserved for purchase by a single buyer. These listings have the attribute is_private.Private listings have limited visibility on the site: they do not appear in search, browse or the seller's shop and are excluded from most Listing API endpoints.  There is also a more restrictive set of actions that can be taken on private listings. Sellers cannot renew or feature these listings.  Private listings also can't be added to Treasury Lists or Favorites.Please see the note on findAllShopListingsActive for more information about interacting with private listings on behalf of a seller.

state.description: One of active, removed, sold_out, expired, alchemy, edit, create, private, or unavailable.

user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user who posted the item.

category_id.description: The numeric ID of the listing's category.

title.description: The listing's title. This string is valid if it does not match the following pattern: /[^\p{L}\p{Nd}\p{P}\p{Sm}\p{Zs}]/u. The characters %, :, & and + can only be used once each.

ending_tsz.description: The listing's expiration date and time, in epoch seconds.

original_creation_tsz.description: The date and time the listing was originally posted, in epoch seconds.

price.description: The item's price (will be treated as private for sold listings).

currency_code.description: The ISO (alphabetic) code for the item's currency.

quantity.description: The quantity of this item available for sale.

tags.description: A list of tags for the item. A tag is valid if it does not match the pattern: /[^\p{L}\p{Nd}\p{Zs}\-']/u

category_path.description: Name of the category of the item and the names of categories in that hierarchy.

category_path_ids.description: The numeric ID of each category in the this Listing's category hierarchy.

materials.description: A list of materials used in the item. A material is valid if it does not match the pattern: /[^\p{L}\p{Nd}\p{Zs}]/u

shop_section_id.description: The numeric ID of the shop section for this listing, can be null

featured_rank.description: Position in the Featured Listings portion of the shop

state_tsz.description: The time at which the listing last changed state.

url.description: The full URL to the listing's page on Etsy.

views.description: The number of times the listing has been viewed on Etsy.com (does not include API views).

num_favorers.description: The number of members who've marked this Listing as a favorite

shipping_template_id.description: The numeric ID of the shipping template associated with the listing.

processing_min.description: The minimum number of days for processing for this listing.

processing_max.description: The maximum number of days for processing for this listing.

who_made.description: Who made the item being listed.

is_supply.description: True if the listing is a supply.

is_private.description: Is this listing a private listing that is intendend for a specific buyer and hidden from shop view. (NOTE: This field is experimental and may change at any time.)

occasion.description: What is the occasion for this listing.

style.description: Style of this listing. Each style is a free-form text string such as "Formal", or "Steampunk". A Listing may have up to two styles. A style is valid if it does not match the pattern: /[^\p{L}\p{Nd}\p{Zs}]/u

non_taxable.description: If this flag is true, any applicable shop tax rates will not be applied to this listing on checkout.

is_customizable.description: If this flag is true, a buyer may contact the seller for a customized order. Can only be set when the shop accepts custom orders and defaults to true in that case.

is_digital.description: True if this listing is for a digital download.

file_data.description: Written description of the files attached to this digital listing.

has_variations.description: True if variations are available for this Listing.

language.description: The IETF language tag (e.g. 'fr') for the language in which the listing is returned.

User.description: The user who posted the listing.

Shop.description: The shop to which the listing belongs.

Section.description: The shop section to which the listing belongs.

Images.description: An array of images for the listing.

MainImage.description: The main image associated with this Listing

ShippingInfo.description: An array of destinations and shipping prices for this listing.

ShippingUpgrades.description: An array of shipping upgrades for this listing.

PaymentInfo.description: An array of accepted payment methods for this listing.

Translations.description: An array of translations for this Listing.

Manufacturers.description: An array of manufacturers used in the making of this listing

Variations.description: An array of variations for this Listing. (NOTE: This can only be used with the getListing and getTransaction methods.)

createListing.description: Creates a new Listing. NOTE: A shipping_template_id is required when creating a listing. NOTE: All listings created on www.etsy.com must be actual items for sale. Please see our guidelines for testing with live listings.

ListingImage.description:
A photograph of a listing for sale.The ListingImage resource includes
fields for the following sizes, which be officially supported by Etsy at least
through the end of 2013:
Additional sizes are available but do not have specific fields in the
resource. Instead, treat the full size URL as a template. Use the

ImageType methods to retrieve available sizes for listing images;
any of these can be subsituted in place of "fullxfull" in the full size
URL to make a new URL for the listing image of that size.The 570xN and fullxfull image sizes have variable dimensions depending on the original artwork uploaded by the seller:If the provided sizes don't suit your application, you are free to download the larger image sizes, resize and cache them for your own use, as long as you adhere to our API Terms of Use.Image uploads can be performed using a POST request with the Content-Type: multipart/form-dataheader, following RFC1867.  This is identical to using curl -F, except that that request needs to be signed using OAuth.Your OAuth toolkit must support multipart form uploads as described above.  Here is example code for PHP using the PECL OAuth 1.1 extension (PECL OAuth 1.0 will not work):

listing_image_id.description: The numeric ID of the listing image.

hex_code.description: The image's average color, in webhex notation.

red.description: The image's average red value, 0-255 (RGB color).

green.description: The image's average green value, 0-255 (RGB color).

blue.description: The image's average blue value, 0-255 (RGB color).

is_black_and_white.description: True if the image is in black & white.

listing_id.description: The numeric value of the listing id the image belongs to.

url_75x75.description: The url to a 75x75 thumbnail of the image.

url_170x135.description: The url to a 170x135 thumbnail of the image.

url_570xN.description: The url to a thumbnail of the image, no more than 570px width by variable height.

url_fullxfull.description: The url to the full-size image, no more than 1500px width by variable height.

full_height.description: Height of the image returned by url_fullxfull.

full_width.description: Width of the image returned by url_fullxfull.

Listing.description: The listing to which the image belongs.

findAllListingImages.description: Retrieves a set of ListingImage objects associated to a Listing.

uploadListingImage.description:
Upload a new listing image, or re-associate a previously deleted one. You may associate an image
                                      to any listing within the same shop that the image's original listing belongs to.
                                      You MUST pass either a listing_image_id OR an image to this method.
                                      Passing a listing_image_id serves to re-associate an image that was previously deleted.
                                      If you wish to re-associate an image, we strongly recommend using the listing_image_id
                                      argument as opposed to re-uploading a new image each time, to save bandwidth for you as well as us.
                                      Pass overwrite=1 to replace the existing image at a given rank.

deleteListingImage.description:
Deletes a listing image. A copy of the file remains on our servers,
                                       and so a deleted image may be re-associated with the listing without
                                       re-uploading the original image; see uploadListingImage

Manufacturer.description: Data about the outside manufacturers that a shop works with.This resource has no methods.

description.description: The manufacturer's description as it appears on the Shop About page.

ParamList.description: This is an associative array that maps parameter names to types.  It has a varying number of fields with differing names.This resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

param_name.description: Each field in the record represents an Etsy API method parameter.  The value corresponds to one of the documented data or resource types.

Payment.description: Represents a Payment made with Direct Checkout.  Please note all monetary amounts are in USD pennies unless otherwise specified.This resource has no associations.

amount_gross.description: The original gross amount of the order, in pennies - this is grand total, including shipping and taxes.

amount_fees.description: The original card processing fee of the order in pennies.

amount_net.description: The total value of the payment less fees (amount_gross - amount_fees).

posted_gross.description: The gross amount which posted to the ledger once shipped. This is equal to the amount_gross UNLESS the seller issues a refund prior to shipping. We consider "shipping" to the event which "posts" to the ledger. Therefore, if the seller refunds first, we simply reduce the amount_gross and post that amount. The seller never sees the refunded amount in their ledger. This is equal to the "Credit" amount in the ledger entry.

posted_fees.description: Amount of the fees that posted when shipped. We refund a proportional amount of the fees when a seller refunds a buyer. If they refund prior to shipping, the posted amount will be less then the original.

posted_net.description: The total value of the payment at the time of posting it to the ledger less fees (posted_gross - posted_fees)

adjusted_gross.description: If the payment is refunded, partially or fully, this is the new gross amount after the refund.

adjusted_fees.description: If the payment is refunded, partially or fully, this is the new fee amount after the refund.

adjusted_net.description: The total value of the payment after refunds less fees (adjusted_gross - adjusted_fees).

currency.description: What currency the payment was made in.

shipping_user_id.description: The numeric id of the user to which the order is being shipped.

shipping_address_id.description: The numeric id identifying the shipping address.

billing_address_id.description: The numeric id identifying the billing address of the buyer.

status.description: Most commonly "settled" or "authed". Marks the current status of the payment.

shipped_date.description: The date and time the payment was shipped in Epoch seconds.

create_date.description: The date and time the payment was created in Epoch seconds.

update_date.description: The date and time the payment was last updated in Epoch seconds.

findShopPaymentByReceipt.description: Get a Payment by Shop Receipt ID

PaymentAdjustment.description: Represents refund on a Direct Checkout Payment. Please note all monetary amounts are in USD pennies unless otherwise specified.This resource has no associations.

status.description: The status of the Payment Adjustment. Can be OPEN, REFUNDED, ERROR, or REFUND_FAILED.

reason_code.description: A human-readable string describing the need for the refund.

total_adjustment_amount.description: The total amount of the refund.

total_fee_adjustment_amount.description: The amount of card processing fees associated with this adjustment.

create_date.description: The date and time the payment adjustment was created in Epoch seconds.

update_date.description: The date and time the payment adjustment was last updated in Epoch seconds.

findPaymentAdjustments.description: Get a Payment Adjustments from a Payment Id

findPaymentAdjustment.description: Get a Direct Checkout Payment Adjustment

PaymentAdjustmentItem.description: A Direct Checkout Payment may have adjustments, or refunds. These adjustments can have different items, associated with the area being refunded, like shipping, sales tax, or the item itself. Please note all monetary amounts are in USD pennies unless otherwise specified.This resource has no associations.

payment_adjustment_item_id.description: The payment adjustment item's numeric ID.

adjustment_type.description: A human readable string describing the area being refundedOne of: TRANS, TAX, or SHIP

amount.description: The total amount of the payment adjustment item.

transaction_id.description: The numerice ID of the Credit Card Transaction

create_date.description: The date and time the payment adjustment item was created in Epoch seconds.

findPaymentAdjustmentItem.description: Get a Direct Checkout Payment Adjustment Item

Receipt.description: Represents proof of payment from a user to a shop for one or more transactions.

order_id.description: The numeric ID of the order this receipt is associated with.

seller_user_id.description: The numeric ID of the seller for this receipt.

buyer_user_id.description: The numeric ID of the buyer for this receipt.

last_modified_tsz.description: Last modification time, in epoch seconds.

name.description: The name portion of the buyer's address.

second_line.description: The second line of the buyer's address.

city.description: The city for the buyer's address.

state.description: The state for the buyer's address.

zip.description: The zip code of the buyer's address.

country_id.description: The numeric ID of the buyer's country.

payment_method.description: The payment method used. May be pp, cc, ck, mo, or other (stands for paypal, credit card, check, money order, other).

payment_email.description: The email address where payment confirmation is sent.

message_from_seller.description: An optional message from the seller.

message_from_buyer.description: An optional message from the buyer.

was_paid.description: True if the receipt was paid.

total_tax_cost.description: The total sales tax of the receipt.

total_price.description: Sum of the individual listings' (price * quantity). Does not included tax or shipping costs.

total_shipping_cost.description: The total shipping cost of the receipt.

currency_code.description: The ISO code (alphabetic) for the seller's native currency.

message_from_payment.description: The machine generated acknowledgement from the payment system.

was_shipped.description: True if the items in the receipt were shipped.

buyer_email.description: The email address of the buyer.

seller_email.description: The email address of the seller.

discount_amt.description: The total discount for the receipt, if using a discount (percent or fixed) Coupon. Free shipping Coupons are not reflected here; check the Coupon object for these.

subtotal.description: total_price minus coupon discounts. Does not included tax or shipping costs.

grandtotal.description: total_price minus coupon discount plus tax and shipping costs.

shipping_tracking_code.description:
The tracking code for the shipment.
                            DEPRECATED: This field will be removed by 10/2013. Use shipments  instead. When a receipt has more than one shipment, behavior of this field is unspecified.

shipping_tracking_url.description:
The tracking URL for the shipment.
                            DEPRECATED: This field will be removed by 10/2013. Use shipments  instead. When a receipt has more than one shipment, behavior of this field is unspecified.

shipping_carrier.description:
The shipping carrier.
                            DEPRECATED: This field will be removed by 10/2013. Use shipments  instead. When a receipt has more than one shipment, behavior of this field is unspecified.

shipping_note.description:
The shipping notification note text.
                            DEPRECATED: This field will be removed by 10/2013. Use shipments  instead. When a receipt has more than one shipment, behavior of this field is unspecified.

shipping_notification_date.description:
The date the last shipping notification was sent.
                            DEPRECATED: This field will be removed by 10/2013. Use shipments  instead. When a receipt has more than one shipment, behavior of this field is unspecified.

shipments.description: Shipment information associated to this receipt.

Country.description: The country to which the order was shipped.

Buyer.description: The buyer of the items in this receipt.

Seller.description: The seller of the items in this receipt.

Transactions.description: The transactions associated to this receipt.

Listings.description: The listings associated to this receipt.

Segment.description:
A Marketplace Browse Segment - The model which maps to the hierarchical marketplace segment names visible
            on the left side of Etsy.com and inside of pages starting with /browse. More information is in this
            Etsy News Blog post.

name.description: The formatted name for this Segment

path.description: The sequence of slugified names leading up to (and including) this Segment, separated by period characters

short_name.description: The slugified name of this Segment

has_children.description: Whether this Segment has more Segments under it

image_url.description: (Optional) A fullxfull image representing this Segment

shop_id.description: (Optional) The shop_id of the Shop from which the image_url was chosen

shop_name.description: (Optional) The name of the Shop from which the image_url was chosen

listing_id.description: (Optional) The id of the listing from which the image_url was chosen.

MainImage.description: The main image for the listing.

SegmentPoster.description:
A Marketplace Browse Segment Poster which represents a set of Marketplace Browse Segments
        - These represent the curated pages that sometimes appear inside of Browse Pages, full of both links to segments
        below the level of the current path, and images to represent each curated sub-segment. More information is in this
        Etsy News Blog post.This resource has no associations.

name.description: The formatted name for this SegmentPoster

path.description: The sequence of slugified names leading to a Segment represented by this SegmentPoster

image_url.description: A fullxfull image representing this SegmentPoster's content

shop_id.description: (Optional) The id of the Shop from which the image_url was chosen

shop_name.description: (Optional) The name of the Shop from which the image_url was chosen

weight.description: A number starting at 1 representing how prominent this SegmentPoster is relative to other SegmentPosters

listing_id.description: (Optional) The id of the listing from which the image_url was chosen.

findBrowseSegmentPosters.description: Find Browse SegmentPosters by Segment slug

ShippingInfo.description: Shipping fees for a listing and a specific destination.The diagram below is an ERD of the relevant portion of the database related to Listings. Each Listing has a User, and each User can have 0 or more ShippingTemplates. We are enforcing that a user create at least one ShippingTemplate before creating a listing.  When that Listing is created the ShippingTemplate gets copied into the ShippingInfo table and is associated to that Listing. You can then edit the ShippingInfo directly for a listing, or update your ShippingTemplate and update the Listing with it.

shipping_info_id.description: The numeric ID of this shipping info record.

origin_country_id.description: The numeric ID of the country from which the listing ships.

destination_country_id.description: The numeric ID of the country to which the listing ships (optional). If missing, these fees apply to all destinations.

currency_code.description: Identifies the currency unit for shipping fees (currently, always 'USD').

primary_cost.description: The shipping fee for this item, if shipped alone.

secondary_cost.description: The shipping fee for this item, if shipped with another item.

listing_id.description: The numeric ID of the listing to which this shipping info applies.

region_id.description: The numeric ID of the region to which this shipping info applies (optional). If missing, no region is selected.  Regions are shorthand for lists of individual countries.

origin_country_name.description: The name of the country from which this item ships.

destination_country_name.description: The name of the country to which this item ships.

DestinationCountry.description: The full Country record for the shipping destination.

OriginCountry.description: The full Country record for the shipping origin.

Region.description: The full Region record for the shipping destination region.

findAllListingShippingProfileEntries.description: Retrieves a set of ShippingProfileEntries objects associated to a Listing.

updateShippingInfo.description: Updates a ShippingInfo with the given id.

deleteShippingInfo.description: Deletes the ShippingInfo with the given id.

ShippingOption.description: Represents a shipping option for a cart.This resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

shipping_option_id.description: The numeric ID of the shipping option.

value.description: The name of the shipping option.

price.description: The total cart shipping price if the shipping option is selected.

currency_code.description: The ISO (alphabetic) code for the shipping option's currency.

ShippingTemplate.description: Represents a template used to set a listing's shipping information.The diagram below is an ERD of the relevant portion of the database related to Listings. Each Listing has a User, and each User can have 0 or more ShippingTemplates. We are enforcing that a user create at least one ShippingTemplate before creating a listing.  When that Listing is created the ShippingTemplate gets copied into the ShippingInfo table and is associated to that Listing. You can then edit the ShippingInfo directly for a listing, or update your ShippingTemplate and update the Listing with it.

shipping_template_id.description: The numeric ID of this shipping template.

title.description: The name of this shipping template.

user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user who owns this shipping template.

min_processing_days.description: The minimum number of days for processing the listing.

max_processing_days.description: The maximum number of days for processing the listing.

processing_days_display_label.description: Translated display label for processing days.

origin_country_id.description: The numeric ID of the country from which the listing ships.

Entries.description: An array of shipping info entries that belong to this template.

Upgrades.description: An array of shipping upgrades for this shipping template.

deleteShippingTemplate.description: Deletes the ShippingTemplate with the given id.

findAllShippingTemplateEntries.description: Retrieves a set of ShippingTemplateEntry objects associated to a ShippingTemplate.

findAllUserShippingProfiles.description: Retrieves a set of ShippingTemplate objects associated to a User.

ShippingTemplateEntry.description: Represents one entry in a shipping template.The diagram below is an ERD of the relevant portion of the database related to Listings. Each Listing has a User, and each User can have 0 or more ShippingTemplates. We are enforcing that a user create at least one ShippingTemplate before creating a listing.  When that Listing is created the ShippingTemplate gets copied into the ShippingInfo table and is associated to that Listing. You can then edit the ShippingInfo directly for a listing, or update your ShippingTemplate and update the Listing with it.

shipping_template_entry_id.description: The numeric ID of this shipping template entry.

shipping_template_id.description: The numeric ID of the template this entry belongs to.

currency_code.description: The currency code for the prices in this template entry.

origin_country_id.description: The numeric ID of the country from which the listing ships.

destination_country_id.description: The numeric ID of the country to which the listing ships (optional).  If missing, these fees apply to all destinations.

destination_region_id.description: The numeric ID of the region to which the listing ships (optional).  Regions are collections of countries.

primary_cost.description: The shipping fee for this item, if shipped alone.

secondary_cost.description: The shipping fee for this item, if shipped with another item.

OriginCountry.description: The full Country record for the shipping origin.

DestinationCountry.description: The full Country record for the shipping destination.

DestinationRegion.description: The full Region record for the shipping destination region.

Template.description: The template to which this entry belongs.

ShippingUpgrade.description: Represents shipping upgrade info.This resource has no associations.

shipping_profile_id.description: Identifier for the parent shipping profile

value.description: Name of the shipping upgrade, e.g. USPS Priority

price.description: Additional cost of adding the shipping upgrade

secondary_price.description: Additional cost of adding the shipping upgrade with another item

getListingShippingUpgrades.description: Get the shipping upgrades available for a listing.

createListingShippingUpgrade.description: Creates a new ShippingUpgrade for the listing. Will unlink the listing if linked to a ShippingTemplate.

updateListingShippingUpgrade.description: Updates a ShippingUpgrade on a listing. Will unlink the listing if linked to a ShippingTemplate.

deleteListingShippingUpgrade.description: Deletes the ShippingUpgrade from the listing. Will unlink the listing if linked to a ShippingTemplate.

findAllShippingTemplateUpgrades.description: Retrieves a list of shipping upgrades for the parent ShippingTemplate

createShippingTemplateUpgrade.description: Creates a new ShippingUpgrade for the parent ShippingTemplate. Updates any listings linked to the ShippingTemplate.

updateShippingTemplateUpgrade.description: Updates a ShippingUpgrade of the parent ShippingTemplate. Updates any listings linked to the ShippingTemplate.

deleteShippingTemplateUpgrade.description: Deletes the ShippingUpgrade from the parent ShippingTemplate. Updates any listings linked to the ShippingTemplate.

The first line of the shops address.

second_line.description:
The second line of the shops address.
                            DEPRECATED: use UserAddress.second_line instead.

city.description:

state.description:
The state the shop is in.

The zip code the shop is in.

The numeric ID of the country the shop is in.
                            DEPRECATED: use UserAddress.country_id instead.

accepts_custom_requests.description: True if the shop accepts requests for custom items.

policy_shipping.description: The seller's policy on shipping (may be blank).

policy_refunds.description: The seller's policy on refunds (may be blank).

policy_additional.description: Any additional policy information the seller provides (may be blank).

policy_seller_info.description: The shop's seller information (may be blank).

policy_updated_tsz.description: The date and time the shop was last updated, in epoch seconds.

vacation_autoreply.description: If is_vacation=1, a message to buyers in response to new convos.

name.description:
The shop owner's real name.

This is an experimental feature and may change.)

deleteShopSectionTranslation.description: Deletes a ShopSectionTranslation by shop_id, shop_section_id and language

Style.description: A user-supplied style attached to a listing. A user can either select from suggested styles, or create custom style.This resource has no associations.

ShopTranslation.description: Represents the translation data for a Shop.This resource has no associations.

shop_id.description: The numeric ID for the Shop.

language.description: The IETF language tag (e.g. 'fr') for the language of this translation.

announcement.description: Translation of an announcement to buyers that displays on the shop's homepage.

policy_welcome.description: Translation of the introductory text from the top of the seller's policies page (may be blank).

policy_payment.description: Translation of the seller's policy on payment (may be blank).

policy_shipping.description: Translation of the seller's policy on shipping (may be blank).

policy_refunds.description: Translation of the seller's policy on refunds (may be blank).

policy_additional.description: Translation of any additional policy information the seller provides (may be blank).

policy_seller_info.description: Translation of the Shop's Seller information (may be blank).

sale_message.description: Translation of a message that is sent to users who buy from this shop.

digital_sale_message.description: Translation of a message that is sent to users who buy a digital item from this shop.

title.description: Translation of a brief heading for the shop's main page.

vacation_autoreply.description: Translation of a message to buyers in response to new convos (if Shop.is_vacation is true).

vacation_message.description: Translation of a message to buyers (if Shop.is_vacation is true).

getShopTranslation.description: Retrieves a ShopTranslation by shop_id and language

createShopTranslation.description: Creates a ShopTranslation by shop_id and language

updateShopTranslation.description: Updates a ShopTranslation by shop_id and language

deleteShopTranslation.description: Deletes a ShopTranslation by shop_id and language

Team.description:
Teams represent a community of users on Etsy,
 found at www.etsy.com/teams. 
 Generally, the Etsy API only exposes public teams data. Using OAuth, a team 
 captain may see pending or invited team members using the 
 findAllUsersForTeam method.This resource has no associations.

create_date.description: The date and time the team was created in Epoch seconds.

update_date.description: The date and time the team was last updated in Epoch seconds.

tags.description: A list of tags describing the team.

findTeams.description: Returns specified team by ID or team name

findAllTeamsForUser.description: Returns a list of teams for a specific user

Treasury.description:
The Treasury is
        an ever-changing, member-curated shopping gallery comprised of lists of items. The
        Etsy API allows you to retrieve, create, edit, and delete treasury lists. When
        retrieving multiple lists with findAllTreasuries method,
        you are limited to the 25,000 sortable hottest lists in the Treasury at
        that time. If you need to retrieve a specific list, be sure to use the
        getTreasury method with the corresponding treasury key.
This resource has no associations.

homepage.description: If the Treasury was featured on the homepage, the time in seconds since the epoch that it was featured

mature.description: Whether the Treasury has been flagged mature or not

private.description: Whether the Treasury has been set to private

comment_count.description: The number of comments on this Treasury

tags.description: The tags associated with this Treasury

counts.description: Clicks, views, shares, and reports metrics of this collection

hotness.description: The algorithmic ranking value assigned to this collection

hotness_color.description: The algorithmic ranking value shown as a color (color hexadecimal)

user_id.description: ID of the user (curator) of the collection

user_name.description: Name of the user (curator) of the collection

listings.description: The listings that are in this collection

creation_tsz.description: Time this collection was created, in epoch seconds

became_public_date.description: The time that this treasury was published, in epoch seconds

findAllTreasuries.description: Search Treasuries or else List all Treasuries

findAllUserTreasuries.description: Get a user's Treasuries. Note: The treasury_r permission scope is required in order to display private Treasuries for a user when the boolean parameter include_private is true.

TreasuryCounts.description: Various metrics on the TreasuryThis resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

clicks.description: The number of times the Treasury has been clicked on

views.description: The number of times the Treasury has been viewed

shares.description: The number of times the Treasury has been shared

reports.description: The number of times the Treasury has been reported

Transaction.description: Represents the sale of a single item.

transaction_id.description: The numeric ID for this transaction.

title.description: The title of the listing for this transaction.

description.description: The description of the listing for this transaction.

seller_user_id.description: The numeric ID for the seller of this transaction.

buyer_user_id.description: The numeric ID for the buyer of this transaction.

creation_tsz.description: The date and time the transaction was created, in epoch seconds.

paid_tsz.description: The date and time the transaction was paid, in epoch seconds.

shipped_tsz.description: The date and time the transaction was shipped, in epoch seconds.

currency_code.description: The ISO code (alphabetic) for the seller's native currency.

quantity.description: The quantity of items in this transaction.

tags.description: The tags in the listing for this transaction.

materials.description: The materials in the listing for this transaction.

image_listing_id.description: The numeric ID of the primary listing image for this transaction.

receipt_id.description: The numeric ID for the receipt associated to this transaction.

shipping_cost.description: The shipping cost for this transaction.

is_digital.description: True if this listing is for a digital download.

file_data.description: Written description of the files attached to this digital listing.

listing_id.description: The numeric ID for this listing associated to this transaction.

seller_feedback_id.description: The numeric ID of seller's feedback.

buyer_feedback_id.description: The numeric ID for the buyer's feedback.

Buyer.description: The buyer that is associated with this transaction.

MainImage.description: The primary listing image for this transaction.

Listing.description: The listing that is associated with this transaction.

Seller.description: The seller that is associated with this transaction.

Receipt.description: The receipt that is associated with this transaction.

findAllListingTransactions.description: Retrieves a set of Transaction objects associated to a Listing.

findAllReceiptTransactions.description: Retrieves a set of Transaction objects associated to a Receipt.

findAllShopTransactions.description: Retrieves a set of Transaction objects associated to a Shop.

findAllUserBuyerTransactions.description: Retrieves a set of Transaction objects associated to a User.

TreasuryListing.description: A subset of the Listing resource stored in a TreasuryThis resource has no associations.

data.description: The detailed fields of the listing

creation_tsz.description: Time the listing was added to this Treasury, in epoch seconds

TreasuryListingData.description: The detailed fields of a TreasuryListingThis resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user who posted the item

price.description: The item's price (private for sold listings)

currency_code.description: The ISO (alphabetic) code for the listing's currency

state.description: Whether the listing is active or not

shop_name.description: The shop to which the listing belongs

image_id.description: The ID of the main image of the listing

image_url_75x75.description: The url to a 75x75 thumbnail of the main image.

image_url_170x135.description: The url to a 170x135 thumbnail of the main image.

User.description: Represents a single user of the site.

user_id.description: The user's numeric ID. This is also valid as the user's shop ID.

creation_tsz.description: The date and time the user was created, in epoch seconds.

referred_by_user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user that referred this user.

feedback_info.description: An associative array of feedback totals for the user.

awaiting_feedback_count.description: The total number of transactions the user has available for a new review.

Shops.description: An array of shops that belong to the user.

BuyerReceipts.description: An array of receipts for listings this user has purchased.

BuyerTransactions.description: An array of transactions (sold listings) this user has purchased.

findAllUsers.description: Finds all Users whose name or username match the keywords parameter.

findAllUsersForTeam.description: Returns a list of users for a specific team

getCirclesContainingUser.description: Returns a list of users who have circled this user

getConnectedUser.description: Returns details about a connection between users

unconnectUsers.description: Removes a user (to_user_id) from the logged in user's (user_id) circle

getConnectedUsers.description: Returns a list of users that are in this user's cricle

connectUsers.description: Adds user (to_user_id) to the user's (user_id) circle

UserAddress.description:
Represents a user's address.

    When creating an address using the createUserAddress method, state is a required field if the country is US, Canada, or Australia. For these countries, the value for the state must be one of these abbreviations:

    
        United States: AL, AK, AS, AZ, AR, CA, CO, CT, DE, DC, FM, FL, GA, GU, HI, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, ME, MH, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, ND, MP, OH, OK, OR, PW, PA, PR, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VI, VA, WA, WV, WI, WY, AA, AE, AP
        Canada: AB, BC, MB, NB, NL, NT, NS, NU, ON, PE, QC, SK, YT
        Australia: ACT, NSW, NT, QLD, SA, TAS, VIC, WA

user_address_id.description: The numeric ID of the user's address.

name.description: The user's name for this address.

first_line.description: The first line of the user's address.

second_line.description: The second line of the user's address.

city.description: The city field of the user's address.

state.description: The state field of the user's address.

zip.description: The zip code field of the user's address.

country_name.description: The name of the user's country

Country.description: The full Country record for the user's address.

User.description: The full User record whom entered this address.

findAllUserAddresses.description: Retrieves a set of UserAddress objects associated to a User.

createUserAddress.description: Creates a new UserAddress. Note: state is required when the country is US, Canada, or Australia. See section above about valid codes.

deleteUserAddress.description: Deletes the UserAddress with the given id.

UserProfile.description: Represents a user's public profile. Generally, this is the information available for a member as "Public Profile" on Etsy.comAs of March 28, 2011, the "User" and "Shops" associations of UserProfile no longer exist in the API. Instead, query the User resource directly, using the Etsy member's login name, and/or use the Shops association of User.

user_profile_id.description:
The numeric ID of the user profile.
                            DEPRECATED: Do not use

user_id.description: The numeric ID of the user this profile corresponds to.

login_name.description: The login name of the user that owns this profile.

birth_month.description: The birth month of the user.

birth_day.description: The birth day of the user.

birth_year.description: The birth year of the user.

join_tsz.description: The date and time the user was created, in epoch seconds.

materials.description: A list of the user's favorite materials.

country_id.description: The numeric ID of the user's country.

location.description:
The user's location (self-supplied, free-form text).
                            DEPRECATED: Do not use.

avatar_id.description: The numeric ID of this user's avatar image.

transaction_buy_count.description: The number of bought items for this user.

transaction_sold_count.description: The number of sold transactions for this user.

is_seller.description: If the user is a seller or not. Value true if user is a seller.

image_url_75x75.description: The URL to the user's avatar image; dimensions 75px square.

first_name.description: The first name of the user.

last_name.description: The last name of the user.

Country.description: The country in which the user lives.

findUserProfile.description: Returns the UserProfile object associated with a User.

updateUserProfile.description: Updates the UserProfile object associated with a User. Notes:Name changes are subject to admin review and therefore unavailable via the API.Materials must be provided as a period-separated list of ASCII words.

Variations_Option.description:
Represents an available listing variation option  e.g. Small for the Size property. Options are often provided as a collection of the Variations_Property resource.Variations Custom Property Names and Variations Option Names follow the validation rules for 
Listing title with the following additions:For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

value_id.description: The numeric ID of the option

value.description: The normalized value of the option

formatted_value.description: The formatted/translated value of the option

is_available.description: True if the option is available for purchase

price_diff.description: The additional price, if any, for this option above the Listing's base price. (NOTE: Unavailable options may have negative values.)

price.description: The full price of this option, added to the Listing's base price. (NOTE: Unavailable options may have a price that is lower than the Listing's base price, which is based on the lowest available option price.)

Variations_Property.description:
Represents a property from a list of default or seller-defined properties to describe a variation of a listing. In addition to a default
list including Size, Color, Finish, Dimensions and others, sellers may specify custom properties to more
aptly describe their listings. When available, properties are returned as part of a Listing as the Variations
association.Although a Listing can be assigned any two properties from 
the list of available Variations properties, some properties and values are suggested for Listings in particular categories.  The
Variations_PropertySet resource can be used to access suggestions for a category.Sellers are given their
choice of two custom properties, which can be used for any purpose. When adding custom Variations, be sure to specify a map of
property IDs and names using the custom_property_names field. NOTE: Using custom properties in place
of predefined properties (Size, Color, Width, etc.) may be harmful to a Listing's search relevancy at a later date. Custom properties should
only be used when no other property is suitable.Optional qualifying properties should be specified when appropriate, and may be used in search at a later date. To determine the appropriate
qualifiers and their values, see the Variations_PropertySet resource. (NOTE: If the
recipient_id qualifier is specified here, it will overwrite the value of recipient
on the Listing.  When in doubt, the value appropriate to added Variations should be preferred.)Although a Listing can be assigned any two properties from 
the list of available Variations properties, some properties and values are suggested for Listings in particular categories.  The
Variations_PropertySet resource can be used to access suggestions for a category.Sellers are given their
choice of two custom properties, which can be used for any purpose. When adding custom Variations, be sure to specify a map of
property IDs and names using the custom_property_names field. NOTE: Using custom properties in place
of predefined properties (Size, Color, Width, etc.) may be harmful to a Listing's search relevancy at a later date. Custom properties should
only be used when no other property is suitable.Optional qualifying properties should be specified when appropriate, and may be used in search at a later date. To determine the appropriate
qualifiers and their values, see the Variations_PropertySet resource. (NOTE: If the
recipient_id qualifier is specified here, it will overwrite the value of recipient
on the Listing.  When in doubt, the value appropriate to added Variations should be preferred.)Variations Custom Property Names and Variations Option Names follow the validation rules for 
Listing title with the following additions:For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.

property_id.description: This numeric ID of this property

formatted_name.description: This translated name of this property

getListingVariations.description: Get the listing variations available for a listing.

createListingVariations.description: Update all of the listing variations available for a listing; optionally set custom property names and property qualifiers. Expects a JSON array with a collection of objects of the form: [{"property_id":200, "value":"Black"}, {"property_id":200, "value":"White"}]

updateListingVariations.description: Update all of the listing variations available for a listing. Expects a JSON array with a collection of objects of the form: [{"property_id":200, "value":"Black"}, {"property_id":200, "value":"White"}]

createListingVariation.description: Add a new listing variation for a listing.

updateListingVariation.description: Update a listing variation for a listing.

deleteListingVariation.description: Remove a listing variation for a listing.

BillingOverview.description: A user's account balance on Etsy.This resource has no associations.

is_overdue.description: True if the user has an overdue balance.

currency_code.description: The currency unit in which the user is billed.

overdue_balance.description: The total overdue balance owed by the user.

balance_due.description: The total amount currently due for payment (including any overdue balance.)

total_balance.description: The total amount owed by the user (including fees that are not yet due for payment.)

date_due.description: The date by which the user's balance due must be paid.

date_overdue.description:
The date on which the user's balance became overdue.
                            DEPRECATED: do not use - always returns 0

BillCharge.description: Represents a charge to an Etsy member's account.The type field of BillCharge indicates what the charge is:This resource has no associations.

bill_charge_id.description: The numeric ID for this bill charge record.

type.description: The name of the type of charge.

type_id.description: The Listing, Transaction or Shipping Label ID to which the charge applies.

creation_year.description: Year that the charge was created.

creation_month.description: Month that the charge was created.

last_modified_tsz.description: Time when charge was last modified.

getUserChargesMetadata.description: Metadata for the set of BillCharges objects associated to a User

findAllUserCharges.description: Retrieves a set of BillCharge objects associated to a User. NOTE: from 8/8/12 the min_created and max_created arguments will be mandatory and can be no more than 31 days apart.

Variations_PropertyQualifier.description: A component of the larger Variations_PropertySet data structure, a property qualifier is a recursive data structure describing increasing specificity of a property. For example, for a listing in the Clothing: Pants category, the Size property is further qualified by the Recipient and Scale qualifying properties. A property qualifier describes these dependencies.For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

property_id.description: The numeric ID of this property

options.description: An array of numeric IDs of available options for this property qualifier

results.description: Recursive qualifiers representative of inreased property specificity (Keys are numeric strings)

aliases.description: Option values listed here share qualifier settings with other options (Keys are numeric strings)

Variations_PropertySet.description:
When managing variations of a listing, a property set is a data structure that defines how a property is specified for a given category. For instance, the Size property requires varying degrees of specificity when describing Clothing: Pants as opposed to Jewelery: Rings; the additional specificity allows us to suggest more appropriate options  e.g. mens UK pant sizes  for a given property. Properties and Property Sets describes in further detail how to interpret this data.Although a Listing can be assigned any two properties from 
the list of available Variations properties, some properties and values are suggested for Listings in particular categories.  The
Variations_PropertySet resource can be used to access suggestions for a category.Sellers are given their
choice of two custom properties, which can be used for any purpose. When adding custom Variations, be sure to specify a map of
property IDs and names using the custom_property_names field. NOTE: Using custom properties in place
of predefined properties (Size, Color, Width, etc.) may be harmful to a Listing's search relevancy at a later date. Custom properties should
only be used when no other property is suitable.Optional qualifying properties should be specified when appropriate, and may be used in search at a later date. To determine the appropriate
qualifiers and their values, see the Variations_PropertySet resource. (NOTE: If the
recipient_id qualifier is specified here, it will overwrite the value of recipient
on the Listing.  When in doubt, the value appropriate to added Variations should be preferred.)For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.

property_set_id.description: Numeric ID of this property set

properties.description: Dictionary of properties that are available as variations

qualifying_properties.description: Dictionary of properties that are used to add specificity to one or more variation properties

options.description: Dictionary of available property options for any of the qualifying properties

qualifiers.description: Recursive data-structure indicating the property options available for qualifying_properties, and the nested qualifiers available for each option

findPropertySet.description: Find the property set for the category id

Variations_PropertySetOption.description:
Represents a suggested option value for a listing on Etsy, dependent on the listing's
category, and one or more qualified properties (size scale, recipient, etc.)Although Etsy listings can contain any value for any available property, it's recommended
to use these suggested options whenever possible.  They may be integrated into Etsy search
at a later date.For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.

formatted_name.description: property option name, formatted for display

findAllSuggestedPropertyOptions.description: Finds all suggested property options for a given property.

Variations_PropertySetProperty.description:
Represents a suggested Variations property as part of a set of suggested
properties and options, dependent on one or more qualifiers (size scale, recipient, etc.)
For more information, see Variations_PropertySet.Although Etsy listings can contain any value for any available property, it's recommended
to use these suggested properties whenever possible.  They may be integrated into Etsy search
at a later date.For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

property_id.description: This numeric ID of this property

label.description: Descriptive text label for form input

param.description: Specifies the qualifier parameter when requesting suggested options for a property

default_option.description: Initial option value for form input

is_custom.description: True if this property is Custom 1 or Custom 2

Variations_PropertySetOptionModifier.description:
Represents rules for display of Variations property options on Etsy, dependent on one
or more qualifiers (size scale, recipient, etc.)  The resource specified text that should
come before and after the option.

When accessing existing Variations_Option records  on Etsy listings, the field
formatted_value
will already have these display rules applied.  This resource is only useful when adding new Variation options to listings, in
order to preview the options as they will appear once saved.For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.

prefix.description: Indicates text that should be prepended to property options

suffix.description: Indicates text that should be appended to property options

getPropertyOptionModifier.description: Add a value for a given property.

Variations_SelectedProperty.description: A data structure representing a buyer's selected variation for a listing. Returned as a collection as a property on CartListing and Transaction.When in the context of a CartListing, special attention should be paid to the is_valid property. This will be false in the event that the variation has been changed or removed since the listing was added to the cart. Additionally, the purchase_state property of the parent CartListing will have a value of edited to signal this state. In this case the listing needs to be removed and re-added to the cart with a valid variation.For full documentation on working with Listing Variations, see Working with Variations.This resource has no associations.This resource has no methods.

property_id.description: The numeric ID of the selected property

value_id.description: The numeric ID of selected value

formatted_name.description: The formatted/translated name of the selected property

formatted_value.description: The formatted/translated name of the selected value

is_valid.description: Whether the selected variation value is a valid option for this property. NOTE: This field will not be present on Transactions.
